comments:
I am trying to bring my Eclipse 2.1.2 plugin up to Eclipse 3.0 and it is not
working as of M9. My plugin extends org.eclipse.ui.importWizards but when I try
to run the plugin the following stack trace is generated and it fails with the
following error: "The selected wizards could not be started. Reason: Plug-in
com.ibm.ws.build.plugin was unable to load class
com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.create.PluginImportFEWizard."
I have included the log file and the plugin.xml under that. Thanks very much for
the help.

PLUGIN.XML


<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<plugin
   id="com.ibm.ws.build.plugin"
   name="%pluginName"
   version="1.0.0"
   provider-name="IBM Corp. - WebSphere Server Group"
   class="com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.EclipseToolsPlugin">

   <runtime>
      <library name="wsbld_plugin.jar">
         <export name="*"/>
      </library>
   </runtime>
   <requires>
      <import plugin="com.ibm.ws.build.wsant" version="5.0.0"
match="compatible"/>
      <import plugin="org.apache.xerces"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.core.resources"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.ui"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.swt"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.debug.core"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.debug.ui"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.jdt.launching"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.jdt.core"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.ui.externaltools"/>
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.jdt.ui"/>
   </requires>


   <extension
         point="org.eclipse.ui.importWizards">
      <wizard
            name="%CompImportWizard.label"
            icon="icons/icon16_full.bmp"
            class="com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.create.PluginImportWizard"
            id="com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.create.PluginImportWizard">
         <description>
            %CompImportWizard.description
         </description>
      </wizard>
      <wizard
            name="%FEImportWizard.label"
            icon="icons/icon16_full.bmp"
            class="com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.create.PluginImportFEWizard"
            id="com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.create.PluginImportFEWizard">
         <description>
            %FEImportWizard.description
         </description>
      </wizard>
   </extension>
   <extension
         point="org.eclipse.ui.popupMenus">
      <objectContribution
            objectClass="org.eclipse.core.resources.IResource"
            nameFilter="*.xml"
            id="com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.menu">
         <action
               label="%RunWsbld.label"
               tooltip="%RunWsbld.tooltip"
               class="com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.wsant.RunWsbldAction"
               menubarPath="additions"
               id="RunWsbldAction">
         </action>
      </objectContribution>
      <objectContribution
            objectClass="org.eclipse.core.resources.IResource"
            nameFilter="component.xml"
            id="com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.menu">
         <menu
               label="Wsbld"
               path="additions"
               id="com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.menu.parent">
            <separator
                  name="group1">
            </separator>
         </menu>
         <action
               label="%UpdateClasspathAction.label"
               tooltip="%UpdateClasspathAction.tooltip"
               class="com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.create.UpdateClasspathAction"
               menubarPath="com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.menu.parent/group1"
               id="UpdateClasspathAction">
         </action>
         <action
               label="%SwitchToSourceAction.label"
               tooltip="%SwitchToSourceAction.tooltip"
               class="com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.create.SwitchToSourceAction"
               menubarPath="com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.menu.parent/group1"
               id="SwitchToSourceAction">
         </action>
         <action
               label="%SwitchToBinaryAction.label"
               tooltip="%SwitchToBinaryAction.tooltip"
               class="com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.create.SwitchToBinaryAction"
               menubarPath="com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.menu.parent/group1"
               id="SwitchToBinaryAction">
         </action>
      </objectContribution>
   </extension>

</plugin>

If a plug-in requires ui in 2.1.2, I believe the transformations to the new
refactoring of plug-in ids should happen for free. Moving to Equinox for comment.

Jerry: check out the porting guide here:
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/~checkout~/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/porting/eclipse_3_0_porting_guide.html

I have tried going through the porting guide a few times in different ways with
no success.  I have tried entering the plugin.xml tags for which version of
Eclipse the plugin was written in and I have added org.eclipse.ui.ide import and
tried both the org.eclipse.core.runtime and org.eclipse.runtime.compatibility
and all end with the same result.  Any other ideas would be helpful.  Thanks!

Please run eclipse with the -console option and then type the "headers <bundle 
ID>" command at the osgi> prompt with the bundle ID of your plugin that is 
failing.  For example:

osgi> headers 22

Where 22 is your plugin's bundle ID.  You can findout the bundle ID of your 
plugin by running the "ss" command at the osgi> console.  This will list all 
the plugins and their bundle ID's that are installed in the Framework.  This 
information will tell us if your plugin.xml was converted correctly.

When I run the headers command on my program this is the output I get.  When
running the ss command I notice that my plugin is in the installed stated.  I
hope this is helpful.

plugin in question and see if it looks sane (i.e., headers should not be 
duplicated).  Please attach that manifest file to this bug report.

instead of application/octet-stream.

I don;t think we are getting anywhere on this.  The manifest etc looks ok.  The 
actual problem you are seeing is when loading the PluginImportFEWizard. That 
class appears to be found (thus the defineClass()) entry on the stack but while 
defining that guy the JFace Wizard class cannot be found/loaded. This is very 
curious.  

We need actual code that we can run and see the problem (or steps to reproduce 
in our environment).

Do you still have a problem with RC1?
Can you run your 2.1 plugin without modifying it at all?

The problem still exists with RC1.  I can not post code here since the plugin
I'm using is listed as internal use only.  However, the plugin is available for
download at this website (it requires IBM intranet authentication)
https://websphere.raleigh.ibm.com/multibuild/MB_eclipse.html

The plugin here can be directly unzipped into the eclipse\plugins folder to run.
 Thanks for the help.
I will take a look at the plugins

The com.ibm.ws.build.wsant_5.0.0 plugin does not seem to be correct.  The 
library jar ant.jar from this plugin contains the class 
com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.create.PluginImportFEWizard.  This class is also 
included in the com.ibm.ws.build.plugin plugin.

The com.ibm.ws.build.plugin plugin requires com.ibm.ws.build.wsant_5.0.0 so 
when the com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.create.PluginImportFEWizard class is loaded 
to create the Extension from the com.ibm.ws.build.plugin plugin the class ends 
up being loaded from the com.ibm.ws.build.wsant_5.0.0 plugin.  But 
com.ibm.ws.build.wsant_5.0.0 does not require any ui plugins so it does not 
have access to any jface components.  

So when defining the com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.create.PluginImportFEWizard class 
using the classloader of com.ibm.ws.build.wsant_5.0.0 it tries to load the 
org.eclipse.jface.wizard.Wizard.  Since com.ibm.ws.build.wsant_5.0.0 does not 
have access to this package a NoClassDefFoundError is thrown.

I think you are seeing this now because in Eclipse 3.0 we changed the lookup 
order for when you require a plugin.  All the required plugins are searched 
before your own plugin is searched for a class.  In eclipse 2.1.2 your plugin 
was searched before the plugins you required.  So in eclipse 2.1.2 you would 
have loaded the com.ibm.ws.build.plugin.create.PluginImportFEWizard class from 
the correct plugin.

The issue has been resolved and it was ebcause of what Thomas Watson has said
above.  The issue was resolved by removing the plugin files from the ant.jar. 
Thank you very much for your help.
